meanings.sent1: After losing his keys, he had to reidentify them by looking in all the usual spots.
meanings.sent2: The detective was reidentifying the suspect based on new evidence found at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: She kept reidentifying her pet cat every time it meowed, thinking it was a different cat each time.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph was so faded that reidentifying the faces in it was like solving a mystery.
meanings.sent5: Reidentifying the correct password is crucial to access the secure account.

meanings.definition: To recognize or establish the identity of someone or something again
meanings.sent1: The security guard had to reidentify the visitor before allowing them into the building.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was reidentifying the species of bird he had discovered in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept reidentifying the same volunteer from the audience as different people during the show.
meanings.sent4: Reidentifying the lost dog from the shelter was like finding a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist was reidentifying the ancient artifacts found in the tomb.
